peopleAlsoAsk.question: Which ball mason jars are valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Blue Mason Jars Of all the colors, the blue Mason jar is one of the most sought-after. The specific shade of blue that the Ball Corporation introduced in the 1890s was believed to block out sunlight, extending the life of the canned food.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: The Expert Guide to Dating and Collecting Antique Jars

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can you tell if a mason jar is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Look for the number 13 on the bottom of the old blue ball jars. Those are really the only ones worth flipping. I used to deal with antiques a lot. The story goes that people were very superstitious back in the day so a lot of the number 13 jars were smashed. Not sure how true that is, but I have sold many for $40-80.
